Now, on perusal of the offence u/s 3 of POCSO Act it appears that section 3 defined the nature of the act/acts which constitutes the penetrative sexual assault and section 4 of the POCSO Act provides punishment for any of the act/acts done by accused as defined in section 3 (a) to (d) of POCSO Act.

issue:

7. Discussion, Decision and reasons for such decision :-
decision:
Therefore, this court has no option but to acquit the accused Alaluddin from the offence u/s 376(2)(n)/448 IPC and section 4 of POCSO Act on the ground of insufficient evidence and set him at liberty forthwith.
